awd_titl_txt: Acquisition of High Performance Thin-Layer Chromatography   (HPTLC) System
awd_abstract_narration: Research programs of five principal investigators at the                        University of Wisconsin (Madison) focus on the secondary                        chemistry (allelochemicals) of plants.  These programs involve                  studies of:                                                                                                                                                          1.   Effects of genetic factors and environmental stresses                           plant secondary chemistry.                                                                                                                                 2.   Consequences of variation in plant chemistry for plant                          resistance to insect and mammalian herbivores.                                                                                                             3.   Genetic engineering and in vitro production of unique                           organic compounds by plants.                                                                                                                          The requests HPTLC system is essential for expeditious progress                 in these research areas because it is the only analytical system                capable of rapid chromatographic analysis of the large numbers of               samples required.  Moreover, it is ideally suited for analysis of               labile compounds, which are central to the work of several of the               research programs.  Without the capabilities offered by HPTLC,                  progress in the respective research areas will be seriously                     impeded.//
